root.name: pow()
root.description: Facilitates exponential expressions. The pow() function is an efficient way of multiplying numbers by themselves (or their reciprocal) in large quantities. For example, pow(3, 5) is equivalent to the expression 3*3*3*3*3 and pow(3, -5) is equivalent to 1 / 3*3*3*3*3.

parameter.label: num
parameter.description: int or float: base of the exponential expression

parameter.label: exponent
parameter.description: int or float: power of which to raise the base
